g.text: Neglect
Definition:
"When your method of learning about the world
is biased, learning more may not help. Acquiring
more data can even consistently *worsen*
a biased prediction."
Example:
Urn with balls of different colors
Guess the proportion of red & white balls in
the urn given that you can't open the urn, only
blindly pick 10 balls (e.g. 3 red & 7 white ones)
Definition:
"A cognitive bias is a systematic error in
*how we think*, as opposed to a random error
or one that’s merely caused by our ignorance."
Definition:
Grounding one’s judgments in how well sets of
characteristics feel like they fit together, and
neglecting how common each characteristic is in
the population at large.
Example:
Given some information about a person, guess
which job they're more likely to have.
E.g. are they more likely to be a salesman or a
librarian, if they're shy?
Definition:
"[P]eople’s tendency to feel committed to things
they’ve spent resources on in the past, when they
should be cutting their losses and moving on."
Definition:
"Knowing about these biases, unfortunately,
doesn’t make you immune to them. It doesn’t even
mean you’ll be able to notice them in action."
Example:
Subjects of an experiment had difficulty "neutrally
evaluating the quality of paintings if they knew
the paintings were by famous artists" – and they
even predicted this bias before the experiment
started – yet they believed that their assessments
were objective

text.font-family: Excalifont, Xiaolai, sans-serif, Segoe UI Emoji

g.text: What "Rationality:

text.font-family: Excalifont, Xiaolai, sans-serif, Segoe UI Emoji

g.text: From AI to Zombie" is

text.font-family: Excalifont, Xiaolai, sans-serif, Segoe UI Emoji

g.text: Trying to Achieve?
"The approach to debiasing in this book is to
communicate a systematic understanding of *why good
reasoning works*, and of how the brain falls short of it."
"The goal of this book is to lay the groundwork for
creating rationality “expertise.” That means acquiring a
deep understanding of the structure of a very general
problem: human bias, self-deception, and the thousand
paths by which thought can defeat itself."
